column4: Exclusive: U.S. probes allegations AB InBev seeking to curb craft beer distribution
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Justice Department is probing allegations that Anheuser-Busch InBev  is seeking to curb competition in the beer market by buying distributors  making it harder for fast-growing craft brewers to get their products on store shelves  according to three people familiar with the matter.

column4: AB InBev says talking to DOJ  California AG about two planned distributor deals
column5: WASHINGTON Anheuser-Busch InBev said it is talking to both the  U.S. Justice Department and the California attorney general's office about any queries they have about its plans to acquire two beer distributors in California  the company confirmed on Monday.

column4: UK company pension insurance deals seen totalling $15 bln in 2015-Aon Hewitt

column4: Chesapeake Energy board member Martin named chairman

column4: China stocks jump after PBOC says correction "almost over"  HK extends rebound
column5: SHANGHAI  Oct 12 China shares jumped over 3 percent on Monday to their highest level in seven weeks after the central bank took fresh steps to inject liquidity into the struggling economy and said the stock market's correction "is almost over".

column4: Eli Lilly halts study of heart drug  stock tumbles
column5: Eli Lilly and Co has stopped a late-stage trial of its closely watched cholesterol treatment after it proved ineffective  sending its stock down more than 9 percent and casting greater skepticism over the potentially lucrative class of medicines.

column4: Eli Lilly discontinues heart drug development
column5: Oct 12 Eli Lilly and Co said it stopped development of its experimental heart drug  evacetrapib  and scrapped a late-stage study as the treatment did not show enough efficacy in the trial.

column4: Eli Lilly expands cancer tie-up in fast-growing China market
column5: SHANGHAI  Oct 12 Eli Lilly and Co has expanded a tie-up up with China-based biopharmaceutical company Innovent Biologics Inc to develop cancer treatments for the fast-growing Chinese market  the two companies said in a joint statement on Monday.

column4: UAW locals compact Fiat Chrysler voting to 2 days
column5: DETROIT All 40 000 union members at Fiat Chrysler Automobiles U.S. will vote on a proposed new contract on Oct. 20 and 21  rather than stretch the balloting over more than a week as was done in the recent failed vote  the United Auto Workers (UAW) union said on Monday.
